com.mesosphere.sdk.state

Enum GoalStateOverride

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<GoalStateOverride>
      • com.mesosphere.sdk.state.GoalStateOverride
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<GoalStateOverride>

    public enum GoalStateOverride
extends java.lang.Enum<GoalStateOverride>
    The definition of a goal state override for a task. These are custom states, other than GoalStates, which a task may enter. The main difference between this and GoalState is that GoalStates are configured by the service developer, whereas GoalStateOverrides are applied by the operator.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  GoalStateOverride.Progress
      The state of the override itself.
      static class  GoalStateOverride.Status
      Describes the current state of an override.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      NONE
      The definition of the default no-override state.
      PAUSED
      The definition of the "PAUSED" override state, where commands are replaced with sleep()s.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String PAUSE_COMMAND
      Sleep forever when pausing.
      static java.lang.String PAUSE_READINESS_COMMAND
      Plans should not assume that a paused task has fulfilled the requirement of its dependencies.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • NONE

        public static final GoalStateOverride NONE
        The definition of the default no-override state. Refer to the task's GoalState setting.

      • PAUSED

        public static final GoalStateOverride PAUSED
        The definition of the "PAUSED" override state, where commands are replaced with sleep()s.

    • Field Detail

      • PAUSE_COMMAND

        public static final java.lang.String PAUSE_COMMAND
        Sleep forever when pausing.

      • PAUSE_READINESS_COMMAND

        public static final java.lang.String PAUSE_READINESS_COMMAND
        Plans should not assume that a paused task has fulfilled the requirement of its dependencies. Returnging an always failing readinness check guarantees that plan execution does not interpret a paused task as being ready.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • newStatus

        public GoalStateOverride.Status newStatus(GoalStateOverride.Progress progress)

      • getSerializedName

        public java.lang.String getSerializedName()
        The label which tasks in this state are given. For example "RUNNING" or "PAUSED". This is shown to users and stored in task state storage.

        WARNING: THIS IS STORED IN ZOOKEEPER TASK METADATA AND THEREFORE CANNOT EASILY BE CHANGED

      • getTransitioningName

        public java.lang.String getTransitioningName()
        The state which tasks which are in the process of entering this state are given. For example "STARTING" or "PAUSING". This is shown to users but not stored anywhere.
